intro: Melanthera biflora var. ryukyuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu melanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth texture. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
